text: On tap at Terroir NYC. Hazy gold with slight head. Nose is floral, spicy. Taste is wheat, spices.
Pale aroma of malt, wheat and citrus. Limited palate but decent taste of citrus, wheat, grass, spice and tart. Probably the best pale lager ever?

Tap at the source. Pours light lemon, white ring of lacing. Aroma is lemon, wheat, spicy note, maybe clove, light maybe nutmeg, maybe cinnamon. Flavor is lemon, lager, bit of corn almost, wheat, mild clove.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head. Spices on the nose, soft musk, a good amount of ginger, lemon. Medium bodied, ginger, soft musk, light wheat. Grain and wheat. Ginger lingers into the finish, grain and musk. Crisp and musky.

Cloudy, pale straw. Fresh cut hay, bready. Some bitterness, predominantly malty sweet. Light body, reasonably well carbonated. Fine.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler from Whole Foods. There is a pleasant spicy, pine resin aroma. Very nice flavor! Wheat, lemon, some pine and grapefruit. Im not always excited by hoppy wheat beers, but this is very well balanced. There is some smooth sweetness too. Looking at the reviews, people are all over the map about this one - I guess that is the sign of an adventurous release. It was very good imo.  Btw I dont see why RB has this listed as a pale lager - Im not sure what it is, but I dont think it is that - spice/herb/veg most likely.
Pours rather unclear blonde . Smell is fresh , bitter . Taste is bitter , oranges . Bit citrussy in the back . Nice
Draught @Albion. Slightly cloudy rich yellow with somewhat creamy small white head, slught citrus aroma, a bit metallic astringent taste, abrupt finish. Not especially remarkable.

Had on draft at Roberta's in Bushwick. Didn't appreciate the plastic cups, loved the beer. Totally opaque, thin fizzies, and almost a sour taste (but in a good way). Loved it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at the brewery taproom. Pours hazy yellow with a creamy white head. Nice biscuity pale malt nose, some straw. Light sweet flavor with some biscuits, light lemon notes. Light bodied with average carbonation. Crisp finish, light ginger notes, some lemon essence, dry biscuits. Good. 3.7

Hazy straw-colored body, medium to thin white head, spotty lacing. Light grainy cereals, grass, coriander, and a touch of citrus. Flavor is muted, but similar to the nose. Light bodied with moderate carbonation, mild sweetness, muted, slightly thin finish.
draft at blue monk, buffalo ny. yellow pour, slightly hazed, lemon citrus, coriander, citrus zest. decent
Cask @ pony bar. Hazy orange, aroma is spices & lots of ginger, fresh orange, faint bitter hop. Tastes spicy with some light tangerine, faint hop.. Light body.
Pours a light orange. Has an earthy aroma with grains, grass, pines, wheat, and some malt. Taste is very malty with light citrus and grass.

From tap. Pours hazy light orange. A potpourri of spice on nose, similar to a scented candle. Taste is heavy, with lots of yeast, some coriander. Drier than needed. Was glad I ordered only a half pint. Unbalanced.

Growler. Ive developed quite the love/hate relationship with this beer over the past 5 minutes. On the one hand, it has some lovely noble hops character, especially one the nose, clean and balanced malts, and no real off flavors. But on the other hand, they added coriander to it for some reason. Why? This would be really good, but the coriander kind of throws me. I dont know. Its still an enjoyable beer. but Id really like to try a non-spiced version of this.
cereal, floral, grass, leaves, pale, clear, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, thin feel, lively,

A hazed golden Lager with a thin white head. In aroma, a nice grassy and spiced malt, with grassy hops. In mouth, a nice biscuit malt with grassy notes, chamomile, mineral notes, citrus, nice. On tap at Brooklyn Pour 2013.

On tap. Mild aroma, lightly sweet, some faint spicing. Medium bodied with a malt-sweet finish. Yeast profile seems inappropriate and the beer is a touch heavy for what is supposed to be a sessionable lager. The spices also feel out of place. Not a terrible drink though.

@ Singlecut. Pours hazy golden. Aroma of coriander, other citrus, and wheat. Pretty nice. Taste brings similar flavors, though is slightly astringent. Also get some Sorachi Ace-like hempiness in the taste as well. Finished slightly sticky. A very interesting beer and Im not sure Id ever put this as a pale lager, considering its a wheat beer. Not entirely sure what Id classify it as.

The Sampler, Brooklyn tap: Pours a hazy orange, definitely not white. Aroma is spicy and flowery... quite nice. Taste is pretty nice. A spicy tingle gives this some uniqueness points. Very easy to drink, but not bland or watery. Accessible, but adventurous. Lets also be clear that this is not a pale lager.
Tap. Hazy white yellow pour. Wheat, citrus, Lemon zest. Light and refreshing with medium carbonation. Very easy to drink, especially in the summer
One of the most distinct and palette pleasing beers Ive ever had!!!!

Draft at rattle n hum with clockwork. Pours a deep, but bright hazy orange body with no head and light white lacing. Aroma is faint fruit and grain. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of biscuits, bready malts and light hop.
Draft at Rattle. Pours cloudy yellow gold. White head. Nose and taste of peppermint, winter spices and malt. Light body.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2013 On tap at the brewery. This beer has one if those love it or hate it aromas. Coriander, anise, orange peel, NyQuil?  Palate was fine, but if you dont like the first whiff youre probably not going to like the beer.
UPDATED: MAY 14, 2013 Draft at Astoria Bier and Cheese. Anise, floral, grassy, herbal, grainy finish. Need to try this again, interesting and refreshing.

Tap at Brewers choice.  Pours hazy yellow orange.  Nose of citrus and yeast.  Tastes of oranges, herbal, yeasty, floral, and maybe some wood.  Light and refreshing and much better then most "pale lagers"

Draft at aPORKalypse in LIC . Great fluorescent color. Hops and pine. Great flavor. Easy drinking

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught from their tasting room.  Hazy light yellow with a big rocky head and great lace.  The aroma is a nicely rounded and primarily herbal but with notes of grass, light citrus, wheat, and lightly sweet malt. Also there is an element thats hard to describe and I guess is probably the "lagrrr" yeast contribution.  These continue on the palate.  The flavor is very well balanced with a long herbal bitter finish. The mouthfeel is exceptionally soft and fresh. I could drink this all day and night and with any kind of food and be happy.  Fantastic beer.
Pours a hazy moderately light orange with a white lacing. Fruity weigh hints of orange and maybe even a little coriander, but there is also a hint of fluoride.
